intro: Cymbalaria glutinosa subsp. glutinosa, commonly known as sticky weed or common stickseed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, blue to violet flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a sticky surface, which gives the plant its common name. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
